intro: Photinia cavaleriei, commonly known as the Chinese photinia, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to China. It features glossy, dark green leaves that turn red in the fall, adding ornamental value to gardens. The plant produces small, white flowers in the spring, followed by red berries that are attractive to birds. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Photinia cavaleriei is valued for its compact growth habit and seasonal color changes.
